name: NL All-Stars 50s to 70s Multiple Choice Quiz | All-Star Games | 10 Questions

questions.text: Right Handed Pitcher: Bob Gibson. An awesome power pitcher, who anchored several St Louis teams in the 1960s that made it to the world series. Which of the following was NOT a teammate on those teams?
questions.explanation:
Johnny Callison.

	Bob Gibson had an E.R.A. in 1968 of 1.12 .. you have to be kidding! Johnny Callison starred for the Phillies. He hit a dramatic home run to win the Allstar game.

questions.text: Left handed picher: Sandy Koufax. If you needed one guy to win a game: he made headlines when he tried to negotiate as a 'team' with what other player?
questions.explanation:
Don Drysdale.

	Steve Carlton was a great pitcher, but I have to give the nod to Koufax.

questions.text: First Baseman: Willie McCovey. Great Hitter. Who was the pitcher when he lined out to Bobby Richardson to end the '62 world series?
questions.explanation:
Ralph Terry.

	I considered Orlando Cepeda and Willie Stargell. It was a tough call.

questions.text: Second Base: Pete Rose. A strange guy imo, but ... He antagonized New York Met fans by getting into a brawl with what ballplayer?
questions.explanation:
Bud Harrelson.

	Look at the record book (Jackie Robinson doesn't fit in the time period mid-50s to mid-70s).

questions.text: Shortstop: Ernie Banks. What was he generally best know for?
questions.explanation:
Good attitude.

	'It's a great day for baseball. Let's play two.' Class act, great attitude.

questions.text: Third Base: Ken Boyer. Steady and well-rounded. His brother, also a third baseman, spent the bulk of his career with what team?
questions.explanation:
Yankees.

	Close nod over Mike Schmidt. (Clete Boyer.)

questions.text: Centerfield: Willie Mays: No one even remotely close. When Mays made his famous 'Vic Wertz catch' who did Wertz play for?
questions.explanation:
Indians.

	1954 Series. Probably the best baseball player of all time.

questions.text: Left field: Hank Aaron: give the Home Run King his due. What pitcher gave up the home run that put Aaron past the Babe?
questions.explanation:
Al Downing.

	All those years on power-hitting Brave teams that had no pitching whatsoever.

questions.text: Right Field: Roberto Clemente. He could do it all. Where was he going when he was killed in a plane crash?
questions.explanation:
Nicaragua.

	Tragic end. (Tony Gwynne doesn't fit in this time period.)

questions.text: Catcher: Johnny Bench. Strong in all aspects of the game. Who was the manager of the 'big red machine'?
questions.explanation:
Sparky Anderson.

	Solid all the way around.
